title: SpaceX Starship to implement Hot Staging
summary: SpaceX implementing Hot Staging to Starship Super Heavy Interstage

title: SpaceX changing Starship stage separation ahead of next launch
summary: SpaceX is changing the approach for separating the two stages of its Starship vehicle to increase payload performance before its next test flight, Elon Musk said June 24.

title: Dream Chaser Continues Chasing its Path to the Pad
Centaur Upper Stage Delays ULA Vulcan Maiden Flight
summary: United Launch Alliance (ULA) has announced further delays for the inaugural launch of its Vulcan Centaur rocket due to necessary modifications to the Centaur upper stage.

title: First Vulcan launch further delayed for Centaur modifications
summary: The inaugural launch of United Launch Alliance’s Vulcan Centaur rocket faces new delays after the company said it needs to make “minor reinforcements” to part of the Centaur upper stage.

title: Second Orbiter transfer vehicle malfunctions
summary: An orbital transfer vehicle that was part of a SpaceX rideshare mission malfunctioned shortly after deployment, putting into jeopardy a technology demonstration spacecraft for a satellite servicing startup.

title: Themis, Prometheus complete first hot-fire tests in France
summary: Europe has just completed the first successful hot-fire test of its reusable Prometheus engine integrated with the Themis first-stage demonstrator at the ArianeGroup site in Vernon, France. The hot-fire test consisted of Prometheus performing a 12-second burn on the Themis demonstrator on June 22, 2023.

title: Lynk Global on verge of initial commercial direct-to-device services
summary: A mobile operator in the Pacific island nation of Palau is set to be the first to use Lynk Global’s direct-to-device satellites commercially to keep wireless customers connected outside terrestrial network coverage.

title: NASA Welcomes India as 27th Artemis Accords Signatory
summary: During a ceremony at the Willard InterContinental Hotel in Washington on Wednesday, June 21, India became the 27th country to sign the Artemis Accords. NASA Administrator Bill Nelson participated in the signing ceremony for the agency and Taranjit Singh Sandhu, India’s ambassador to the United States, signed on behalf of India.
